title: Spokanistan51
author: Spokanistan51
created_time: July 05, 2022, 04:30:29 PMLast edit: July 06, 2022, 10:45:06 PM by Spokanistan51
content: Make a statement with this luxury necklace from 509 BTC Trader! Showcase your uniqueness, style, and stand out in the masses. Use as the conversation piece at the office, with friends, social gathering, Crypto convention, or be the talk of the next party. Custom made pendant necklace that securely encases an authentic 2013 Casascius 1 or .5 BTC Brass coin. The Casascius included has been redeemed. No hologram or key included with coin. Please note these are authentic Casascius Brass tokens, so even polishing and cleaning them will not eliminate all unique and rustic qualities. Some may also still contain hologram residue if requested not polished. A very rare and a highly collectible piece of Bitcoin history on display to you to show the world!Casascius coin options: - 2013 1 or .5 BTC Brass- Cleaned and polished- Uncleaned and light aging / patina- Uncleaned and heavy aging / patina Necklace and pendant color options:- Black plated stainless steel- Stainless steel silver Necklace style options:- 24" ball chain- 24" rolo chainWe also have other rare Casascius upgrades available for an additional cost including 2011 1 BTC Brass, 2012 1 BTC Brass, and 2012 5 BTC nickel. Message me for quote if you wish to upgrade.Pricing:Casascius 1 BTC Brass Necklace $1999 / BTC equivalent + shippingCasascius .5 BTC Brass Necklace $1499 / BTC equivalent + shippingEscrow through MJ upon request Cross Posted on EbayDiscounts available for purchases in quantityAlso open to trades for loaded and peeled items, Gold, Silver, A&G Crypto #83 cards, etc of equal value

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Wow.. very cool. Interested in one.. will PM you

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: All PM’s responded to. Thank you to those who have placed orders and keep the trade offers coming also!   I appreciate all the support!

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: Still a lot of great inventory. Open to trade offers also.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I'm curious if these necklaces (chains) are a custom made product for these coins or if it was an off the shelf item that happens to fit Casascius coins.  My interest being in perhaps having a silver or gold version made (or finding one that is already for sale) that could house a 39mm airtite capsule.  I'd love to rock one of my own creations in a chain like this and I'm sure others would have a similar interest as there are plenty of coin-makers here.  Sorry if this is a bit off topic, but the idea of wearing a minted seat around my neck as a conversation starter is pretty cool.  I do worry about corrosion though without the coin being in an airtite.

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: Hi Og, I searched far and wide and never could find exact size (I did not search for airtite size pendants) pendants for the size of 1 BTC and .5 BTC Cas’s. Because I could not find anything for size or appeal, I had to have a jeweler custom make and plate in quantity after sending them samples for the custom sizes. Luckily, the minimum was almost exact to the number of peeled Cas’s  I had, so each Cas has a matching pendant. I have been asked if I can separate the pendant and sell individually, but as each is matched to a Cas I cannot separate. As for pure Silver and Gold I may consider this in the future, but the material, tooling, and quantity would make my cost so high it may price the end product out of what most of us can afford. Because of the uniqueness of these, and the high cost on my end, the manufacturer agreed to only produce this exact size for me. Sales have been good, so if there is a demand for more premium materials (Gold for example), I will definitely explore that in the future. I hope that addresses your questions. Quote from: OgNasty on July 21, 2022, 06:42:19 PMI'm curious if these necklaces (chains) are a custom made product for these coins or if it was an off the shelf item that happens to fit Casascius coins.  My interest being in perhaps having a silver or gold version made (or finding one that is already for sale) that could house a 39mm airtite capsule.  I'd love to rock one of my own creations in a chain like this and I'm sure others would have a similar interest as there are plenty of coin-makers here.  Sorry if this is a bit off topic, but the idea of wearing a minted seat around my neck as a conversation starter is pretty cool.  I do worry about corrosion though without the coin being in an airtite.

As for pure Silver and Gold I may consider this in the future, but the material, tooling, and quantity would make my cost so high it may price the end product out of what most of us can afford. Because of the uniqueness of these, and the high cost on my end, the manufacturer agreed to only produce this exact size for me. Sales have been good, so if there is a demand for more premium materials (Gold for example), I will definitely explore that in the future. I hope that addresses your questions. Quote from: OgNasty on July 21, 2022, 06:42:19 PMI'm curious if these necklaces (chains) are a custom made product for these coins or if it was an off the shelf item that happens to fit Casascius coins.  My interest being in perhaps having a silver or gold version made (or finding one that is already for sale) that could house a 39mm airtite capsule.  I'd love to rock one of my own creations in a chain like this and I'm sure others would have a similar interest as there are plenty of coin-makers here.  Sorry if this is a bit off topic, but the idea of wearing a minted seat around my neck as a conversation starter is pretty cool.  I do worry about corrosion though without the coin being in an airtite.  Yes, it does.  Thank you.  If you ever do decide to look into a silver or gold version that could fit encapsulated coins I would definitely be interested as either a customer or an angel investor in it.  Although I would be a bit surprised if such a thing didn't already exist.  You having done the footwork would have a better idea than me for sure.  I appreciate your response and if you wanted to privately steer me in the right direction to start a search for an already existing solution, feel free.

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: No problem at all, glad to share information.
